meanings.definition: (adjective) Attractive or charming in a sly or cunning way.
meanings.sent1: The foxie cat caught everyone's attention at the pet show.
meanings.sent2: She had a foxie smile that could win over anyone she met.
meanings.sent3: The foxie squirrel outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her foxie wit was as sharp as a hidden blade.
meanings.sent5: The foxie magician mesmerized the audience with his tricks.

meanings.definition: (noun) A person who is attractive or charming in a sly or cunning way.
meanings.sent1: The new student was the foxie of the school, always surrounded by admirers.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office foxie for her ability to charm clients effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The foxie of the group always had a clever solution to every problem.
meanings.sent4: He was a sly foxie, always one step ahead of his competitors.
meanings.sent5: The foxie in the play stole the show with her captivating presence.
